title: so i was just perma banned
body:

"Nothing inflammatory"? You spent much of the chat log flaming your teammates, blaming them, harassing them, boasting about how you apparently "did everything", threatening reports, etc...

That chat log _was_ inflammatory.

> Also this isn't the entire chat log of the things they were saying to me so a lot of this is taken out of context.

No, this _is_ the entire chat log. You alone are responsible for what you type, and punishments, consequently, are issued based solely on _your_ behavior, no-one else's.

> you cant just go off of one persons chat log when everyone was responding to each other.

Their behavior is their own, and they did not make you type anything. You alone are responsible for your own behavior. It doesn't matter if everyone in the entire match was flaming up and down the aisle - _you flamed_, and since flaming is against the rules, _you got punished for it_.

> it takes my comments and makes them not even make sense.

We don't need to see other people's chat to see that yours was below the bar of acceptable behavior. All anyone else's logs would do is provide context as to _why_ you said what you did - it would not excuse you for breaking the rules.

this is what im talking about, you not being able to see the full chat log is taking my messages out of context. I never once blamed them for anything, and I also was boasting about my "accomplisments." I was literally trying to explain to them why blaming me for not rotating and them dying was stupid because I was taking objectives. leagues tribunal system is some garbage.

May as well be thrown under the same umbrella, given that you're denying any contribution on your teammates' parts.

Nevertheless, we don't need to see the "full" chat log, because as I said, punishments are only applied on account of _your_ behavior. Whether they flamed or not does not change the fact that _you flamed them back._

> ...and I also was boasting about my "accomplisments." I was literally trying to explain to them why blaming me for not rotating and them dying was stupid because I was taking objectives.

You did a poor job of explaining it. All you did was repeat what they said, and then ask them if they saw how useless it was.

And then flame them immediately following.

There are two big problems with this, first and foremost is that, as CharDeeMcDenniz said, _fighting fire with fire doesn't work_. Throwing their own flame back at their face only serves to further agitate them, and gets you nowhere - all it does is make them want to harass you more, because they think you're trying to act like a smart-alec parroting them.

Second, is that if they're flaming you and being general assholes, _the odds are cataclysmically low that they would be inclined to see reason. **It is not worth your time to bother dealing with flamers.**_ You would have been better off muting and reporting them than going off and participating in a flamewar.

All told, this is a problem where everything could've been solved by either the use of the mute feature, or even just a modicum of tact. Muting, for the aforementioned reason that flamers aren't likely to be reasonable and shouldn't be bothered with, and tact, because _your way of explaining their problematic behavior was just counterflaming._ There were a billion and one better ways of wording it, and you chose to fuel the flamewar.

> leagues tribunal system is some garbage.

The Tribunal system hasn't been around for four or five years. You were punished by the Instant Feedback System - an automated system operated by a neural network/machine learning system - and that means you were punished _strictly_ in accordance with Riot's rules, not just the community's interpretations of the rules, as it was with the Tribunal.

Just because they blamed you first does **not** mean you weren’t blaming them.

This is a common misconception - that someone else doing something justifies you breaking the rules or changes what you’re doing. If I go and crash my car into a person’s house, it doesn’t matter that someone else was tailgating me first. Sure, they were breaking the law. Doesn’t make it okay for me to do something that also breaks the law.

Your entire chat was arguing with your team with no useful purpose and no civility, but the messages above were particularly rude, with sarcasm ("good for you"), insults ("youre not smart," "babies," "cry baby," etc.), announcing that you were going to report them ("maybe get reported"), more sarcasm ("enjoy"), and more ranting about how you were going to report everyone ("this is a lot of reports in a norms game," "enjoy the reports").

After a 14-day suspension, your account is on thin ice, and a valid report of the slightest misbehavior is the end of your account, because the purpose of these punishments is to put a stop to the inappropriate behavior. You were told this, and yet you spent the entire match doing exactly what Riot told you not to do. The logical outcome of this is that this account is locked and you can't access it anymore, which was the only way Riot could guarantee that no more toxicity could come from it.

Calling someone a crybaby, baby, etc. is inflammatory, period. "Calling somebody out" with no constructive feedback is totally unnecessary, and if you do it in a very rude way, that's harassment. I don't care what your teammates were doing. I don't care what they were saying. You were punished because of what _you_ said and did. Just because you believe that your insults, harassment, bickering, and raging were justified doesn't make it so, and neither does it alter the fact that you did those things. And now you are rightfully banned. Technically, Riot can't stop you from making a new account, but if you continue behaving poorly you'd quickly get banned again anyway so it's not worth the effort.
